titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Zachary Taylor Durham papers, 1869-1876
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, September 2018

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Personal correspondence of Z.T. Durham, with Brantley A. Denmark and Arthur Howell of Savannah, Ga., reflecting the difficulties of Reconstruction, and including a letter describing Southern feelings about the Fourth of July. A letter, 1872, by Durham, describes Texas, and a letter, 1874, from John Snyder in San Francisco, describes that city and other parts of the West.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Zachary Taylor Durham Papers, 1869-1876, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, September 2018.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence of Z.T. Durham, with Brantley A. Denmark and Arthur Howell of Savannah, Ga., reflecting the difficulties of Reconstruction, and including a letter describing Southern feelings about the Fourth of July. A letter, 1872, by Durham, describes Texas, and a letter, 1874, from John Snyder in San Francisco, describes that city and other parts of the West.
